CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National edition, July 11, 1942, pg. 15, reads: "Inkspots Added To 'Double V' Honor Roll - The famous Ink Spots have been added to the honor roll of 'Yankee Doodle Tan' pluggers. The 'Double V' song was introduced at a recent Pittsburgh dance engagement to 1,000 ardent fans of the Ink Spots and Dos Wheeler's Sunset Royal orchestra.  Pictured with the top rhythm quartet is James G. Thompson, campaign director, and amiable Doc Wheeler.  The gentleman on the extreme right is Ken Bryan, the new arranger and accompanist for the Inks.  Many top artists have pledged their support to do their part to instil 'Yankee Doodle Tan' in heart of every American."
TitMainTitle: The Ink Spots, with James G. Thompson, Doc Wheeler, and Ken Bryan on right holding sheet music for "A Yankee Doodle Tan" with fingers signing V for victory, for Double V Campaign, Savoy Ballroom (Hill City Auditorium)
